ETYMOLOGY: From Latin dictum ('something said'), neuter past participle of dicere ('to say').

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a dictum [about sth] | a dictum [of sb]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A formal pronouncement or authoritative statement from a person or body in power.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 来自有权力的个人或机构的正式宣告或权威性声明。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The judge's final dictum resolved the complex legal dispute.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 法官的最终裁决解决了复杂的法律纠纷。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A short statement that expresses a general truth or principle; a maxim.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 表达普遍真理或原则的简短陈述；格言。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ancient philosophical dictum 'know thyself' remains relevant today.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 古老的哲学格言“认识你自己”至今仍有现实意义。
